dme.forecastiolib

Class ForecastIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • dme.forecastiolib.ForecastIO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ForecastIOInterface

    public class ForecastIO
extends java.lang.Object
implements ForecastIOInterface
    Wrapper for handling forecast calls.

      • ForecastIO

        public ForecastIO(java.lang.String key,
                  double latitude,
                  double longitude,
                  java.lang.String lang,
                  java.lang.String units,
                  java.lang.String[] exclude,
                  boolean extend)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Convenience for the full constructor with the current time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when passed a non valid API key.

      • ForecastIO

        public ForecastIO(java.lang.String key,
                  double latitude,
                  double longitude,
                  java.lang.String lang,
                  java.util.Date time,
                  java.lang.String units,
                  java.lang.String[] exclude,
                  boolean extend)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Instanciate a ForecastIO wrapper.

        Invalid parameters are disregarded for default values.
        Parameters:
        key - API key.
        latitude - Geographic latitude coordinate of a location in decimal degrees.
        longitude - Geographic longitude coordinate of a location in decimal degrees.
        lang - Defines the language in which text summaries are returned.
        time - Define the time for requesting a arbitrary point.
        units - Defines the units of the API response.
        exclude - Used to exclude uneeded reports to reduce latency and saving cache space.
        extend - Request hourly data for the next seven days rather than the next two when set to true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when passed a non valid API key.

      • getExcludeList

        public final java.lang.String getExcludeList()
        Return the exclude string that will be used for the Forecast call.

        Empty string means that no report is excluded.
        Returns:

      • setExcludeList

        public final void setExcludeList(java.lang.String[] excludeList)
        Used to exclude uneeded reports to reduce latency and saving cache space.

        Invalid data blocks are not considered. A valid data block is a FIODataBlockEnum 'enum'.
        If there is not at least one valid data block or if the parameter is null, it will be the same as specifying to not exclude reports at all.
        Parameters:
        Array - of data blocks.

      • addToExcludeList

        public final void addToExcludeList(java.lang.String dataBlock)
        Add a data block to the exclude list if is valid or not already included.
        Parameters:
        dataBlock -

      • resetExcludeList

        public final void resetExcludeList()
        Remove all data blocks from the exclude list.

      • getLang

        public final java.lang.String getLang()
        Returns:
        The lang in which the text summaries are returned.

      • setLang

        public final void setLang(java.lang.String lang)
        Set the lang in which the text summaries are returned.

        If the lang passed is invalid or null, the lang will be set to its default value.
        Parameters:
        lang - Valid FIOLangEnum 'enum'.

      • getTime

        public final java.lang.String getTime()
        Returns the time is used to request a forecast for an arbitrary point in time. Since it's an optional value, null value may be returned.
        Returns:

      • setTime

        public final void setTime(java.util.Date time)
        Set the time to request forecast for an arbitrary point in time.

        If the time specified is null or invalid, the current value will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        -

      • setUnits

        public final void setUnits(java.lang.String units)
        Sets the units of the API response.

        If the units specified is invalid or unkown, the current value will remain unchanged.
        Parameters:
        units - Valid FIOUnitsEnum 'enum'.
